page.title: 11Houses and Home Life
page.content: Most dwellings in Kingston Bagpuize have been built in the last 20 years and have three rooms downstairs, four rooms upstairs. Most have a brick garage attached to them.They are built of brick with a tiled roof. The windows tend to be the picture type allowing a lot of light in. There is a mixture of semi-detached and detached houses and bungalows. Also there are a number of houses and bungalows along the main road built between 1945-1960. The remaining houses 33 in all are a lot older dating back to the 16th century. These are mainly stone built with thatched roofs. In all there are approximately 172 houses and 133 bungalows. There is one large Georgian house, Southmoor House which is an old people's home, and one Elizabethan which is being converted into three houses.
